name: adobe_experience_platform_xdm_services
author: Emily Walpole
meta_keywords: Adobe Experience Platform, Services, Experience Platform, Data Services, XDM, Experience Data Model, Schema Registry, Schema
meta_description: Experience Data Model (XDM) supports the standard schema workflows in Adobe Experience Platform, including schema development principles, working with schemas in the Schema Registry, and the use of standard schemas by Platform services.

pages.title: Schema Design Principles & Best Practices
pages.description: The building blocks, principles, and best practices you will need to know for designing schemas to be used with Adobe Experience Platform.

pages.title: XDM Field Dictionary
pages.description: Experience Data Model (XDM) defines a set of fields with specific definitions and consistent behaviors that you can use when extending or creating schemas within Adobe Experience Platform.

pages.title: Using Standard Schemas in Adobe Experience Platform
pages.description: Adobe Experience Platform uses a workflow based on standard schemas, making it easier to reliably share data across Platform services such as Data Catalog, Unified Profile Service, Experience Query Service, and Unified Segmentation.

pages.title: Schema Registry Developer Guide
pages.description: The Schema Registry provides a RESTful API to list, view, extend, create, and update standard schemas in the registry for Adobe Experience Platform.
